metadata.questionText: \text{If \$5000 is invested at 2\% per year compound interest, what is the value after 3 years?}
metadata.explanation: Use the compound interest formula: A = P(1 + r)^n. Here, A = 5000(1 + 0.02)^3 = 5000(1.02)^3 = \$5306. Note that compound interest means the interest is calculated on the accumulated amount each year.
